required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Post-market Clinical Follow-up Study of the TITAN™ Reverse Shoulder System Used in Primary or Revision Total Shoulder Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The Integra® TITAN™ Reverse Shoulder System (TRS) is a semi-constrained total shoulder construct. When used under the conditions and purposes intended the TRS will relieve pain and restore some functional joint motion to the affected shoulder. The purpose of this study is to assess the short, mid and long term outcomes of the TITAN™ Reverse Shoulder System.

primary_outcome.measure: Survival (lack of implant component removal or revision)
primary_outcome.description: Any implant revisions or device related adverse events must be reported as soon as the event is discovered. Assessment of adverse events will occur at each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy assessed by comparing clinical results after surgery as measured with American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons Score (ASES)
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of ASES compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy assessed by comparing clinical results after surgery as measured with EuroQOL-5 Dimension (EQ-5D) score
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of EQ-5D score compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy assessed by comparing clinical results after surgery as measured with Range of motion (ROM)
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of ROM compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy assessed by comparing clinical results after surgery as measured with Constant score.
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of Constant score compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy assessed by comparing clinical results after surgery as measured with Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS).
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy assessed by comparing clinical results after surgery as measured with SANE (Single Assessment Numeric Evaluation)
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of SANE compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy assessed by comparing clinical results after surgery as measured with Radiographs
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome after surgery will be evaluated using the Radiographs and comparison with pre-operative data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lack of unanticipated device related serious adverse events.
secondary_outcome.description: Any device related adverse events must be reported as soon as the event is discovered. Assessment of adverse events will occur at each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival (lack of implant component removal or revision)
secondary_outcome.description: Any implant revisions or device related adverse events must be reported as soon as the event is discovered. Assessment of adverse events will occur at each clinic visit.

arm_group.description: TITAN™ Reverse Shoulder System (TRS) is a semi-constrained total shoulder construct.

intervention.description: All patients will be operated on with the TITAN™ Reverse Shoulder System (TRS).

study_pop.textblock: Patients who require reverse shoulder replacement due to the inclusions below.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with grossly deficient rotator cuff with severe arthropathy or Subjects with failed joint replacement with grossly deficient rotator cuff
- Subjects with a shoulder joint anatomically and structurally suited to receive the device
- Subjects at least 21 years of age and skeletally mature at the time of surgery
- Subject provided consent to participate in the clinical study (having signed the Informed Consent Form)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects without a functional deltoid muscle
- Subjects with active local or systemic infection
- Subjects with inadequate bone stock in the proximal humerus or glenoid fossa for supporting the components
- Subjects with poor bone quality such as osteoporosis where there could be considerable migration of the prosthesis and/or a chance of fracture of the humerus or glenoid
- Subjects with muscular, neurologic, or vascular deficiencies that compromise the affected extremity
- Subjects with known metal allergies
- Subjects are known to be at risk for lost to follow-up, or failure to return for scheduled visits
- Subjects who are prisoners
- Female subject who are pregnant, nursing, or of childbearing potential while not practicing effective contraceptive methods

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania
